crops.name: Carrot
crops.desc: A classic orange root vegetable that can be munched straight from the soil. Packed with vitamin A and a hint of crunch!

crops.name: Corn
crops.desc: Tall and golden, corn stalks are a staple on any farm. Perfect for popcorn nights or corn on the cob.

crops.name: Tomato
crops.desc: Juicy and red, tomatoes are perfect for salads, sauces, or just munching straight from the vine!

crops.name: Potato
crops.desc: A humble underground treasure that’s as versatile as it gets. Boil, mash, fry—potatoes do it all!

crops.name: Strawberry
crops.desc: Sweet and slightly tart, strawberries are a treat for both the farmer and anyone craving a fruity snack.

crops.name: Cucumber
crops.desc: A cool-weather favorite that’s packed with vitamin C and a hint of crunch. Perfect for salads or just eating raw.

crops.name: Pumpkin
crops.desc: A big orange vegetable that’s great for Halloween decorations and pies alike. Beware of spooky carvings!

crops.name: Onion
crops.desc: A pungent root vegetable that’s great for salads, sauces, or just eating raw. It’s also a great source of vitamin C.

crops.name: Cabbage
crops.desc: A round, leafy vegetable that’s perfect for hearty soups, stews, and even a little sauerkraut.

crops.name: Green_bell_pepper
crops.desc: A mild-tasting pepper that’s great for salads, sauces, or just eating raw. It’s also a great source of vitamin C.

crops.name: Turnip
crops.desc: A colorful vegetable that’s great for salads, sauces, or just eating raw. It’s also a great source of vitamin C.

crops.name: Pineapple
crops.desc: A tropical fruit that’s perfect for snacking or adding to smoothies. It’s also a great source of vitamin C.

technologyData.name: Coal
technologyData.desc: Coal is a fossil fuel that’s been burned for thousands of years. It’s a great source of energy, but it’s also a major polluter.

technologyData.name: Iron
technologyData.desc: Iron is a metal that’s been used for thousands of years. It’s a great source of strength, but it’s also a major polluter.
